comment: "Low stress" is the best way to describe any class taught by him. You can earn an A or B before the semester is over & stop coming (attendance is optional). Tbh, I didn't learn much at all from him but got an A. If youre just taking him for fun and want an A, then do it. But if you're like a math major and NEED to know this stuff, DO NOT take him.

Very unique grading system where nothing counts against you. For example, going up to the board to solve a problem, 3 points. Group worksheets worth 10-20 points handed out each week, and whatever points you get gets added to your grade. Plenty of people earned B's in like 2 months and stopped coming. Super easy, but didn't learn much.

Active learning class. Requires the student to put in effort and is not spoon fed. This is not an issue for students trying to learn. There is a lot of group work, so team up w/ another good student. The grading is black or white. It's completely right or wrong, so be precise and clear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is great. This is my second semester in a row taking him and I've enjoyed both of them. He's kind, fun, and I always feel like I'm going to be successful in the class even if I don't completely understand all of it. I've made some of the best friends I've met here through his group projects. You'll really enjoy his class.

I took his probablity class in the spring and scraped a B. He has a very thick Russian-like accent which can be hard to understand at times. Papers/tests are written by him and can be hard to decipher due to the poor english. Also there's no central work for his class which makes it difficult to learn concepts outside of what he puts on the board.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I actually quite enjoyed this class because I had an amazing group and felt like I could go to others with questions. Sometimes what you have to do on assignments could be clearer, but in the end, if you show up with a good attitude and at least try you will be completely fine. Just have a good attitude and he'll like you. He's great!

His point grading system mean youre grade can only go up. There is literally no penalty for missing assignments or doing poorly on a test. Points can be earned through participation, homework problems and tests. Very low stress. He does not care. It is quite wonderful. Take him in a heavy load course. Easiest class thus far. JUST SHOW UP
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Derado has a very unique grading scheme. It ends up making receiving a good grade in the course rather simple. If you show up, participate, and do some of the required work, you will pass. The professor is very interested in the history of mathematics. His eyes light up whenever he talks of such things. That is always fun.

He isn't completely terrible. He's just lazy, and has an *eccentric* teaching method. As long as you attempt every single assignment, collaborate with the people around you, and do extremely well on the midterm you'll be fine. However if you do take him, make sure you have Friday's off, because that's when you can get extra credit. GO TO CLASS!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

Ask many questions during the group work and he will guide you to the correct answer. His mid term was hard but he put up a slightly altered version of it online for you to work. I would recommend.

Most of your points can be earn by simply participating, but it's still harder than it sounds. He gives rigorous assignments every other week, and he only gives out two hard exams.

You shouldn't believe everything that's posted here, but Dr. Derado is still pretty bad. His weird "points" system results in either getting full credit for a problem, or none. Avoid if possible. Uses a unique currency-like points system that would be alright if the professor wasn't so proficient at lazily avoiding teaching the class how to do the problems he assigns. Please do not waste your time and money with this professor

comment: Barely teaches the class and chooses to have students teach the class. Better hope the students that decide to go up actually know what they're doing or you're stuck erasing until somebody gets the right answer. comment: The tests are all based on the homework and the in class assignments. So if you go to class, participate, do homework, you will do just fine. He is a fair grader, funny and approachable. Lots of opportunities to make a great grade.

He has an accent, but it is easy to understand him. All grades during summer semester come from participation and online assignments. If you do not like working problems out in front of class, then you will not do well in this class. He does not give extra credit on anything, so getting points on assignments is difficult.

Since this class is based off of participation I struggled to maintain my B because I am shy. As I grew in his class I became more open to ask him questions and he was more than willing to help! His class is not just based off of what you learn in class you also need to be self motivated and learn at home.

Class structure isn't suited for math or science majors. You are told to use online software to find answers. If you're good at math, take this class. If this is a terminal math class for you, take it; easy A as long as you are active in class.

Dont let the bad reviews scare you, if you take him you will pass, but you have to work for the A. If you are shy and wont participate in class DO NOT take him! It will be almost impossible to get an A if you do not participate so in that case you need to show up for class. Nice and funny guy! I would definitely take him again!
pay attention and you'll pass

Honestly one of the easiest class I've taken, especially if you like math. Its Stress Free, but you have to pay attention. He helps you if you need it. Ask questions if you are confused he will go over it. Its also good to get in his good graces, do so by participating. You can do nothing until the last month and still make a B in his class.

Easiest Calculus class if you actually participate. There will be no homework overload, no forced textbook purchase or no boring lectures. You can not "lose" points and it is possible to guarantee an A without even taking the final. The student-given lectures are a source of controversy but if you defeat your public speech anxiety, it will be easy.

Great class. Difficult subject. He makes it easy to understand the concepts, and he will go over it as thoroughly as needed. Grades in a way that makes it so easy to get a B and a little challenging to get an A. I never used any books, took notes on what I needed, and passed with an A. Assignments are CRUCIAL. Do not feel discouraged by the tests.

I took Professor Derado for MATH 2390. Participation matters so much in this class. He has a point system, and can be stingy about points. Nice guy. Will help if you ask for it. 2 tests, midterm and final. final looks almost exactly like the final.  Assignment give you a lot of points, if you know the material. Never used a book.

Dr. Derado used a point system that makes it very easy to do well in this class even if you don't understand the material 100% of the time. Points can be earned by going to "Math Talks," answering questions in class, and on assignments and tests. He also allows you to use any resource (including Wolfram Alpha) on assignments and tests.

This class was relatively easy. The class is based on a point system. You must get 120 points to make an A. Pretty much everything gets you points: assignments, exams, answering questions. It's an alright system. The thing I dislike the most about the class is that he has students teach. Which ultimily does not facilitate learning.

Sends other students up to board to teach and that usually left me more confused then when we started. Never had to come to class but i always did and still struggled throughout the semester. The point system of grading he uses is only good to you if you have prior knowledge to the material so you could go up to the board and teach the class.

AMAZING. If you are a math person you will absolutely love him because he explains concepts pretty well, and he uses a point system which is almost nothing to worry about! Participate somewhat, do the assignments, and you're going to get a B without trying. I learned a lot because I enjoyed his teaching although it was different. Would recommend!

This class works on a point system. As long as you participate & do the homework you should be OK. I'm good at math, so this was easier for me. He teaches, but then likes to have the students teach a problem and become the teacher to other students. This does make you think! I really like is he makes you understand WHY you do something. Good class.

The basis of the class is proofs and presentation. So you could expect to have to present proofs. If you do this you can get an easy A and even finish early because of the point system. Struggling and staring at math problems for an hour is the only way to learn proofs

Overall an easy class if you PARTICIPATE and do your homework,but a lot of not so easy content to cover.

Was scared away for 2 years b/c of comments here. Took a diff prof for this class & failed. Never got below a B in math in my life. Took Derado & got an A. Nuff said.
